meanings.definition: A type of kayak used by the Inuit people.
meanings.sent1: The qajaq glided gracefully on the water.
meanings.sent2: I saw a traditional qajaq at the museum.
meanings.sent3: The qajaq race was filled with laughter and excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a qajaq, navigating through the sea of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The colorful qajaq stood out among the other boats.

meanings.sent1: She learned how to qajaq on the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: We will qajaq along the river tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Paddling the qajaq felt like dancing on the water.
meanings.sent4: His words qajaqed smoothly through the conversation.

meanings.sent1: His qajaqing skills improved with practice.
meanings.sent2: The competition showcased the art of qajaqing.
meanings.sent3: Qajaqing under the moonlight was a magical experience.
meanings.sent4: The rhythm of their qajaqing echoed across the lake.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the paddle hitting the water filled the air during the qajaqing event.
